name: SupportGarciaAndDozla
_source: speak;Garcia;My name is Garcia.|Sir Dozla, I've been hearing a lot about you lately.
speak;Dozla;Only good things, I hope!|Ha ha ha!|I've heard of you, too, Sir Garcia.|Mostly about your incredible strength!|Hey, would you mind lifting this boulder?|Just kidding!|Ha ha ha!
speak;Garcia;Ha ha.|It's not a big deal.|Are you normally this...energetic?
speak;Dozla;Well, I stuffed myself, so I'm feeling pretty great!
speak;Garcia;You can't fight on an empty stomach.|Eating is very important to keep up your strength.|Especially breakfast.|I've heard that in some cultures, they call breakfast “first break.”
speak;Dozla;A fast what?|Huh?|Speak plainly!|I don't understand all this talking in circles.
speak;Garcia;We don't eat anything while we sleep, so it's as if we are fasting.|So, the meal you eat in the morning breaks that fast.|This means that breakfast is an especially important meal.
speak;Dozla;Huh.|Who would have thunk it?|The only thing I consumed this morning was knowledge!
speak;Dozla;Just that I make it a point to learn other disciplines.|You have to if you want to grow as a fighter.
speak;Garcia;I completely agree.|Young men in this army are strong in their specific fields, but weak in others.|The art of complete training has been lost on the younger generation, I'm afraid.

speak;Dozla;Yes, that's right!|Back in our day, fighters had to learn many disciplines in case they had to fill in for a wounded teammate.|I've always wanted to learn archery.|The delicate precision is the opposite of fighting with an axe.
speak;Garcia;Me, too.|Why don't we meet sometime and study it together?
speak;Dozla;I had a great time last time!
speak;Dozla;I just love sparring!|It's like having a conversation, except with weapons!
speak;Garcia;You DO know that you're not supposed to swing the bow like an axe, right?|Ha ha!
speak;Dozla;I was only clowning around!|I'm recalling that a certain someone loaded the arrow in the wrong direction and nearly impaled his shoulder.|Hmmm. Now, who could that have been?
speak;Garcia;That was a defect in the arrow!
speak;Dozla;Ha ha ha ha ha!|I'm sure!
speak;Garcia;Maybe you just can't teach old dogs new tricks.
speak;Dozla;I don't believe that's true at all.|You're magnificent with an axe.|How hard can it be to learn something new?
speak;Garcia;No, you're the great one.|You're a menace to the enemy!
speak;Dozla;Where did you learn to fight like that?

speak;Garcia;Well, I used to lead troops in Renais.|I learned the basics there...|Once I retired, I was living on a mountain.|My daily chores involved swinging an axe, although just for splitting firewood.
speak;Dozla;See?|You learned how to apply your skills to different fields.|Maybe archery just isn't our thing.|We should try something else.
speak;Dozla;It can't be that difficult to learn.|As far as I can tell, it's just a bunch of arm waving and shouting gibberish.
speak;Garcia;That did not go as well as I had hoped.
speak;Dozla;Well, that's not entirely true, is it.
speak;Garcia;It would have helped if you hadn't whacked me in the head with the staff.
speak;Dozla;I didn't mean to hit you!|You just got in the way when I was...conjuring.
speak;Garcia;I still have a lump on my head.
speak;Dozla;I feel badly about it, all right?|Besides, I think you're forgetting that I also healed you with that staff!
speak;Garcia;No, you didn't!|You burned my beard clear off!
speak;Dozla;You have to admit, though, you looked quite dashing without that beard.|It took at least ten years off of your appearance.|No, at least twenty!
speak;Garcia;You really think so?|I can't stop smelling burnt hair.
speak;Dozla;But, wait!|At least give me credit for making it grow back that quickly.
speak;Garcia;Very well.|It grew back nicely.|Thank you.
speak;Garcia;This little foray into other disciplines has certainly taught me a lot.
speak;Dozla;Me, too!|After all this, sword fighting should be a piece of cake!
